sitename: VA Beach Dept. of Public Health
cleaned_text: Virginia Department of Health (VDH) Resources Masking Studies and Information Myths and Facts about COVID-19 Vaccines Accurate vaccine information is critical and can help stop common myths and rumors. It can be difficult to know which sources of information you can trust. Need more details on these COVID-19 myths and facts, as well as dispelling others, please visit the [CDC's page here](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/facts.html). Importance of Getting Vaccinated Can we Trust the Vaccine? Are Covid-19 Vaccines Safe? Centers for Disease Facts](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/facts.html) The Virginia Beach Department of Public Health Women, Infants and Children (WIC) Program continues to accept new applicants to apply for services. Remote WIC services are available for new families to enroll in the program. Appointments will be conducted over the phone. [Click here](https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/content/uploads/sites/131/2020/04/WIC-Press-Release-04172020.pdf) for more information.
